council-address.name: Consell Regulador de la Denominació d'Origen Alella
council-address.postal-address: Masia Museu Can Magarola. Av. Sant Mateu, 2

denomination.description: Between tradition and urbanity, Alella's vineyards are blessed by the sea breeze, between land and endangered islands in a soles that allow for good drainage and retain solar radiation. A full Mediterranean climate on the part near the beach converts the inland band into a more continental microclimate. The Litoral mountain range slows down the winds and condenses the sea's humidity. This small area has historically provided the wine market of Barcelona, and for centuries has presided over the tables of Barcelona's well-wishers. The white wines are the most characteristic of Alella, dry or sweets, made with a sum of different varieties. They are lights, perfumed and crystalline. The white grape stands out, sometimes shaded with chardonnay o White Sauvignon. The pinks are fresh, aromatic and pleasant. They are made with Grenache, pink bread and merlot. The Red wines are fruity and softy, and are made with cabernet sauvignon, Ull de llebre - Tempranillo and merlot.

council-address.name: Consell Regulador de la Denominació d'Origen Catalunya

denomination.description: The wine forms part of the tradition and history of Catalonia. As much for geography as for climate, there is a multiform diversity in its wines that finds in human action a unity that distinguishes it. The common varieties make up the identity of this Denomination of Origin that extends well into the wine region of our country. The DO Catalunya is defined by the will to promote quality and increase commercialisation options, with a mention that is synonymous with good faith in the main international markets. The diversity of authorised root varieties favours experimentation, both in the field and in the cellar. For this reason, the DO Catalunya is considered an innovative Denomination of Origin. There are powerful Red wines, with a frank and intense aroma, very balanced. White wines are, in general, very fruity. Pinks and traditional liqueurs, mistels and natural sweets complete the offer of this DO.

council-address.name: Consell Regulador de la Denominació d'Origen Conca de Barberà
council-address.postal-address: Torre del Portal de Sant Antoni c/ de la Volta, 2

denomination.description: The Abbey of Poblet and the Orde of Templars constitute the historical places of this wine-producing tradition area. Modernist wineries, known as the wine cathedrals, make up their cultural heritage. This region, surrounded by mountains and crossed by the River Francolí, enjoys a Mediterranean microclimate with a continental influence that causes temperature differences between day and night. They are only formed by the erosive action of the river. Geography and climate are alien to the Conca de Barberà in order to give it optimum conditions for the conreo of the vineyard. Freshness is the most important quality of Conca de Barberà's wines. The pinks elaborated with the native variety Trepat endow this area with a singular personality. From the Conca de Barberà comes one of the most prestigious white wines, made with chardonnay. The Macabeo and parellada varieties give consistent and light wines. Because they are Red, elaborated with Red Grenache, Ull de llebre - Tempranillo and Trepat, they are silky and soft.

council-address.name: Consell Regulador de la Denominació d'Origen Costers del Segre

denomination.description: The territory of Costers del Segre covers land in the counties of Pallars Jussà, Pallars Sobírà, El Segrià, L'Urgell, Pla d'Urgell, Les Garrigues, La Noguera and La Segarra. There are seven sub-areas: Raïmat, Segrià, Pallars, Les Garrigues, Vall de Riu Corb, Artesa de Segre and Urgell. The thermal contrast of the continental climate is accentuated by high heat dissipation and low rainfall. Each sub-area presents climatic and soil differences, and landscapes that combine mountain and flat. The Costers del Segre nexus is the character of its winegrowers and the first-line technology, modern and innovative. Red Cabernet Sauvignon, Pinot Noir, Merlot and Tempranillo head the diversity of wines that are produced there. They are powerful, balanced and structured. Rosemary of Tempranillo, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon are fresh and fruity. The whites are classic, made from Macabeo, Xarelo and Parellada, or modern, Chardonnay, White Sauvignon or Riesling. Part of the production of white grapes is mainly used for the production of Cava.

council-address.name: Consell Regulador de la Denominació d'Origen Empordà

denomination.description: The sea and the mountain form a landscape of harmonic hardness, where the vine grows cross to land to avoid the consequences of the Tramuntana. The climate is Mediterranean, with influences from southern and cold southern winds, moderate winters and hot summers but tempered by breezes. Insolation is high and remarkable rainfall. The lands are poor and acidic, with good drainage and suitable for the production of quality wines. Empúries is traditionally considered as the gateway where the Greeks introduced the cultivation of the vineyards on the peninsula. The Pinks, elaborated with Carignan, Red Grenache and Lledón predominate. They are fruity, fresh, moderate and very tasty. Reds are made with Grenache or Cabernet Sauvignon and they are fruity and light. The whites, elaborated with Macabeo, Parellada, Xarelo, Chardonnay, White Grenache are fresh and tasty. Grenache de l'Empordà is an exceptional sweet wine, typical of the area, warm and silky.

council-address.name: Consell Regulador de la Denominació d'Origen Montsant

denomination.description: In the form of a ring, and with most of the territory in the Priorat region, except for some lands of the Ribera d'Ebre, DO Montsant is defined as a new, modern and active Denomination of Origin. The climate is Mediterranean with continental features. The precipitations are scarce and there are accentuated oscillations of temperature, although the south is warmer. In terms of soils, we can find three different types, although there are a lot of diversity within each group. In the periphery of the DO we have compact, calcareous soil, where the pebbles and slabs of the river terraces and rogerous fersialitic soils predominate. In the Falset area, we find granite, fertile but with little water retention capacity. In some areas of Cornudella and Falset, we have siliceous slates, which are called "llicorelles", are poor soil in organic matter and stony. The vines have a low yield, a characteristic that defines the wines of this area, which makes them very prized. The red wines, the most important in quantity, are made with Carignan, Red Grenache and Tempranillo, and also for blends with cabernet sauvignon, Hairy Grenache, Merlot, Monastrell, Red Picapoll and Syrah. They are custard wines. The whites are preferably made with white and Macabeo grenache, and to a lesser extent with chardonnay, muscatel, parellada and pansal. They can also be found pink and liqueur.

council-address.name: Consell Regulador de la Denominació d'Origen Penedès
council-address.postal-address: Edifici Àgora, Plaça Àgora, Pol Industrial Domenys II

denomination.description: One of the richest and most diverse regions of the wine-growing Europe and the area with the highest production and international projection in Catalonia: El Penedès, which also stands out for the quality of its products and the dynamism of its people. The lands are formed by small hills that sail from the sea to Montserrat, passing through small valleys of different rivers. The climate is Mediterranean, tempered, warm and soft, with remarkable seasonal thermal oscillations. The low rainfall and the high level of sunlight contribute to making Penedès an optimal area for the cultivation of the vineyard. The diversity of wines is the most outstanding feature of the Penedès. Great producer of white wines. Traditional white wines are light, aromatic, cheerful and with little body. The needle and pink wines are fragrant, with intense and persistent aroma. In recent times, the production of red wines, which have body, has been significantly increased, are silky, aromatic and balanced.

council-address.name: Consell Regulador de la Denominació d'Origen Pla del Bages
council-address.postal-address: Casa de la Culla. C/ de la Culla, s/n

denomination.description: In the middle of Catalonia, in the eastern part of Central Depression, there is a wine island, the Pla de Bages. The Mediterranean microclimate of the mountain, a low rainfall and a very strong thermal oscillation are ideal for the cultivation of the vineyard. The wavy and poor soils form the personality of their wines. The climatic rigor entails yields of short grapes, but of an excellent quality. The vineyards, dry stone constructions, make up the landscape of this territory, and are an example of the wine-growing tradition of the Pla de Bages. The elaboration of red wines is quite important. Tempranillo, Merlot, Sumerian and Sauvigon Cabernet are the most widely used varieties, and, to a lesser extent, Red Grenache, Pinot Noir and Syrah. They are fruity and with a good aroma. Picapoll is the most emblematic autochthonous variety, and gives rise to light and exquisite white wines. There are also white Macabeo, parellada and chardonnay. pinks are modern, of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.

council-address.name: Consell Regulador de la Denominació d'Origen Priorat

denomination.description: The prestige of the Priorat is recognized with the highest mention of quality: the qualified denomination of origin. The weather is abrupt and extreme, with very acute heat oscillations between day and night. The geography of this area of ​​ancient wine-making tradition is spectacular, with beams and costers of steep slopes that you must build terraces for the cultivation of the vineyard. The floors are formed by slates that receive the name of llicorelles. Soil and climate produce very low yields of grapes and give wines of this area a very unique personality. The Priorat are mainly red, made from Carignan, Red Grenache and hairy, and, to a lesser extent, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. They present a very high graduation, with very complex aromas, fleshy and round. Elegant and original, they are very welcoming. The white wines produced with white Grenache, Macabeo and Pedro Ximénez, the Red Grenache and the generous and rancid ones complete the production of the Priorat.

council-address.name: Consell Regulador de la Denominació d'Origen Tarragona

denomination.description: The Camp de Tarragona and much of the Ribera d'Ebre form the current Tarragona, a mention that, in the case of wine, coincides with the establishment of the Roman Empire. The good conditions for the cultivation of the vineyard incardinated this area with the wine tradition. The southern band is flat and inland. The northern part is of low mountain, it is born to the sea and it extends until the coastal mountain range. The climate is temperate, of Mediterranean color, without extreme changes of temperature. Rainfall is very irregular, with precipitations concentrated in early autumn. It is characterized by the diversity of wines, with predominance of whites over Reds and Pinks. The white wines are of moderate graduation, fruity aromas and a marked and pleasant body. pinks are thin, fresh and elegant. The Red, corporal, light, warm and fleshy. Sweet liquor and dry rancid wines present aromas and flavors. The Tarragona Classic, excellence in the area, and the mass wine are outstanding.

registered-wineries.winery: Celler Cooperatiu Sant Jaume de Benissanet
Celler Mas dels Frares, Facultat d'Enologia de Tarragona

council-address.name: Consell Regulador de la Denominació d'Origen Terra Alta

denomination.description: The hills and the depression of the Ebro river form a spectacular landscape in this southern region. The vine grows in the flat parts and the deep valleys of the dry valleys. It is planted in natural terraces, in very permeable areas that allow good drainage. The climate is Mediterranean with a strong continental influence, rains are scarce and strong sunlight. These characteristics are optimal for the production of quality wines, and Terra Alta is working to locate its elaborations, known historically, among the most prestigious. White wines like Macabeo and Grenache varieties predominate. They are powerful and very Mediterranean, lightweight, with fine palate and peculiar taste. The pinks and the Reds, structured and with personality, are elaborated with Carignan, Red Grenache and Hairy Grenache, matched with Tempranillo. pinks are tasty and permanent in the mouth. The Red, sober, with body and very complex.

registered-wineries.winery: Vins i Olis Rosendo Esteve Meix
